message.content:
cs.CL, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.SOC, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the creation of a quality annotated corpus and lexicon for harassment research, specifically on Twitter. The paper focuses on the use of natural language processing techniques to identify different types of harassment content. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language). Additionally, the paper also deals with social media data and the use of human judges for annotation, which could fall under cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) and cs.SOC (Social and Behavioral Sciences). The paper also deals with cyberbullying and offensive language, which could fall under cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). Finally, the paper deals with data crawling and processing, which could fall under cs.CY (Computers and Society).
